favourite.article: Born in Yorkshire, England, Heber developed a strong desire to read at a young age. After his education and traveling for 2 years, he was ordained in the Church of England. In 1822, he was offered a position in Calcutta. He went there and worked indefatigably, also visiting Bombay and Ceylon. He died suddenly in 1826.
